page.title: 17Snelston Village
page.content: Snelston is an attractive, unspoilt estate village of about 150 parishioners. It should stay that way as it is under a conservation order and several of the cottages are Listed Buildings. Col. J G Stanton, who owns most of the estate,} lives in Snelston Hall and several of the houses are occupied by estate workers, past and present. Any houses becoming vacant are sold. Even farm buildings are made into dwellings. The "Stanton Arms" public house is now a private home. There is a well looked after church and graveyard, a Stone Cross War Memorial standing near the "Reading Room", where meetings, etc. are held. There is a Post Office and a telephone booth. Young children go to Clifton or Norbury schools and the seniors are taken to Ashbourne by bus.
